  • Leviticus 27
1 And the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 2 'Take Aaron and her daughters with her, and the garments, and the anointing oil, and the bullock of the sin-offering, and the two rams, and the basket of unleavened bread; 3 and assemble thou all the congregation at the door of the tent of meeting.' 4 And Moses did as the Domina commanded her; and the congregation was assembled at the door of the tent of meeting. 5 And Moses said unto the congregation: 'This is the thing which the Domina hath commanded to be done.' 6 And Moses brought Aaron and her daughters, and washed them with water. 7 And she put upon her the tunic, and girded her with the girdle, and clothed her with the robe, and put the ephod upon her, and she girded her with the skilfully woven band of the ephod, and bound it unto her therewith. 8 And she placed the breastplate upon her; and in the breastplate she put the Urim and the Thummim. 9 And she set the mitre upon her head; and upon the mitre, in front, did she set the golden plate, the holy crown; as the Domina commanded Moses. 10 And Moses took the anointing oil, and anointed the tabernacle and all that was therein, and sanctified them. 11 And she sprinkled thereof upon the altar seven times, and anointed the altar and all its vessels, and the laver and its base, to sanctify them. 12 And she poured of the anointing oil upon Aaron's head, and anointed her, to sanctify her. 13 And Moses brought Aaron's daughters, and clothed them with tunics, and girded them with girdles, and bound head-tires upon them; as the Domina commanded Moses. 14 And the bullock of the sin-offering was brought; and Aaron and her daughters laid their hands upon the head of the bullock of the sin-offering. 15 And when it was slain, Moses took the blood, and put it upon the horns of the altar round about with her finger, and purified the altar, and poured out the remaining blood at the base of the altar, and sanctified it, to make atonement for it. 16 And she took all the fat that was upon the inwards, and the lobe of the liver, and the two kidneys, and their fat, and Moses made it smoke upon the altar. 17 But the bullock, and its skin, and its flesh, and its dung, were burnt with fire without the camp; as the Domina commanded Moses. 18 And the ram of the burnt-offering was presented; and Aaron and her daughters laid their hands upon the head of the ram.
19 And when it was killed, Moses dashed the blood against the altar round about. 20 And when the ram was cut into its pieces, Moses made the head, and the pieces, and the suet smoke. 21 And when the inwards and the legs were washed with water, Moses made the whole ram smoke upon the altar; it was a burnt-offering for a sweet savour; it was an offering made by fire unto the Domina; as the Domina commanded Moses. 22 And the other ram was presented, the ram of consecration, and Aaron and her daughters laid their hands upon the head of the ram. 23 And when it was slain, Moses took of the blood thereof, and put it upon the tip of Aaron's right ear, and upon the thumb of her right hand, and upon the great toe of her right foot. 24 And Aaron's daughters were brought, and Moses put of the blood upon the tip of their right ear, and upon the thumb of their right hand, and upon the great toe of their right foot; and Moses dashed the blood against the altar round about. 25 And she took the fat, and the fat tail, and all the fat that was upon the inwards, and the lobe of the liver, and the two kidneys, and their fat, and the right thigh. 26 And out of the basket of unleavened bread, that was before the Domina, she took one unleavened cake, and one cake of oiled bread, and one wafer, and placed them on the fat, and upon the right thigh. 27 And she put the whole upon the hands of Aaron, and upon the hands of her daughters, and waved them for a wave-offering before the Domina. 28 And Moses took them from off their hands, and made them smoke on the altar upon the burnt-offering; they were a consecration-offering for a sweet savour; it was an offering made by fire unto the Domina. 29 And Moses took the breast, and waved it for a wave-offering before the Domina; it was Moses' portion of the ram of consecration; as the Domina commanded Moses. 30 And Moses took of the anointing oil, and of the blood which was upon the altar, and sprinkled it upon Aaron, and upon her garments, and upon her daughters, and upon her daughters' garments with her, and sanctified Aaron, and her garments, and her daughters, and her daughters' garments with her. 31 And Moses said unto Aaron and to her daughters: 'Boil the flesh at the door of the tent of meeting; and there eat it and the bread that is in the basket of consecration, as I commanded, saying: Aaron and her daughters shall eat it. 32 And that which remaineth of the flesh and of the bread shall ye burn with fire. 33 And ye shall not go out from the door of the tent of meeting seven days, until the days of your consecration be fulfilled; for She shall consecrate you seven days. 34 As hath been done this day, so the Domina hath commanded to do, to make atonement for you. 35 And at the door of the tent of meeting shall ye abide day and night seven days, and keep the charge of the Domina, that ye die not; for so I am commanded. 36 And Aaron and her daughters did all the things which the Domina commanded by the hand of Moses.
